questions.question: What is the primary goal of information security?
options: To prevent all employees from accessing sensitive data
To protect confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information
To install antivirus software on all computers
To encrypt all company emails
questions.feedback: Information security aims to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information (the CIA triad).

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the three main components of the CIA triad?
options: Confidentiality
Integrity
Authentication
Availability
questions.feedback: Authentication is not part of the CIA triad. The CIA triad consists of Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability.

questions.question: Why is information security important for organizations?
options: It's only important for government agencies
It's only required for financial institutions
It protects against financial loss, reputation damage, and regulatory penalties
It's only necessary for companies with over 1000 employees
questions.feedback: Information security is crucial for all organizations as it protects against financial losses, reputation damage, and regulatory penalties.

questions.question: Who is responsible for information security in an organization?
options: Only the IT department
Only the Chief Information Security Officer
Only senior management
Every employee in the organization
questions.feedback: Information security is everyone's responsibility. While IT and security teams lead efforts, all employees play a crucial role.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the concept of 'defense in depth'?
options: Using the strongest possible firewall
Implementing multiple layers of security controls
Focusing all security resources on the most critical assets
Training only the IT department on security practices
questions.feedback: Defense in depth involves implementing multiple layers of security controls so that if one fails, others are still in place to protect the information.
